title: Samsung Galaxy S25 Slim May Use New ALoP Technology for Compact Camera Module, Better Image Quality - Gadgets 360
summary:
Samsung Galaxy S25 Slim May Use New ALoP Technology for Camera

Publication Date: December 26, 2024

Source: Gadgets 360

Samsung is expected to unveil the Galaxy S25 Slim, which will feature the newly developed ALoP (All Lenses on Prism) technology for its telephoto camera, aiming for a thinner device without sacrificing image quality. Leaks suggest that the phone will have a periscope telephoto camera that minimizes the camera bump.

  • Galaxy S25 Slim to debut alongside Galaxy S25 series.
  • ALoP technology reduces camera bump size by shortening telephoto module length by 22%.
  • The device is expected to be under 7mm thick.
  • Triple rear camera setup includes a 200-megapixel ISOCELL HP5 sensor.
  • Pre-orders to start from January 24 to February 3, with potential sales from February 4.
"Confirmed ✅ The S25 Slim features ALoP technology. This allows for a reduction in the thickness of the camera bump, solving the issue of the camera bump appearing protruded." — Jukanlosreve

The Samsung Galaxy S25 Slim is set to be a significant advancement in smartphone camera technology, offering a more accessible design without compromising functionality.
newTitle: Samsung Galaxy S25 Slim May Use New ALoP Technology for Camera

title: Understanding Mars Helicopter Ingenuity’s Last Flight On Mars - Astrobiology News
summary:
Understanding Mars Helicopter Ingenuity's Last Flight On Mars

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Astrobiology

This review takes a close look at the final flight of the agency’s Ingenuity Mars Helicopter, which was the first aircraft to fly on another world.

  • Ingenuity completed its final flight on January 18, 2024.
  • During its mission, it performed 72 flights and flew over 30 times farther than planned.
  • The navigation system failure during Flight 72 likely caused the end of the mission.
  • Despite being grounded, Ingenuity continues to send weather data to the Perseverance rover.
  • Future Mars helicopters may benefit from the findings of Ingenuity's investigation.
“When running an accident investigation from 100 million miles away, you don’t have any black boxes or eyewitnesses.” – Håvard Grip, Ingenuity’s first pilot

Ingenuity’s success and longevity will guide the design of future Mars aerial vehicles, with potential for exploration of terrains unreachable by rovers.
newTitle: Understanding Mars Helicopter Ingenuity's Last Flight On Mars

title: Want to Know the Truth About Kanury Rao: A Visionary Leader in the Immunology Field? - Business Standard
summary:
Want to Know the Truth About Kanury Rao: A Visionary Leader in the Immunology Field?

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Dr. Kanury Rao is a prominent figure in immunology, known for his significant contributions to the field, particularly in cancer research and patient care. His dedication to understanding the immune system has led to advancements that improve health outcomes.

Key Points

  • Dr. Rao has significantly contributed to immunology, focusing on cancer immunotherapy and autoimmune disorders.
  • He co-founded PredOmix Technologies and is the head of the Drug Discovery Research Centre at THSTI.
  • His research aids in the development of critical vaccines and treatments.
  • Recognized with prestigious awards like the Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar Prize and the National Bioscience Award.
  • Despite facing false allegations in his career, he continued to focus on his research and contributions to the field.
“Success requires a lot of hard work and dedication and sidelining all obstacles and difficulties in the path of success.” - Dr. Kanury Rao

Dr. Rao’s contributions to immunology are vital in developing treatments for diseases affecting many lives. His resilience in overcoming challenges further exemplifies his dedication to advancing medical research.
newTitle: Dr. Kanury Rao: A Visionary Leader Transforming Immunology

title: SpaceX Missions List 2025: From Starship Flight 7 Launch to Crew-10 Mission, Here’s Brief on Major - LatestLY
Incremental investment in cement sector will come only when profitability improves: Report | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Incremental Investment in Cement Sector Dependent on Profitability Improvements

Publication Date: December 27, 2023 Source: ANI

The Indian cement industry must improve its profitability significantly to attract future investments, as highlighted in a report by IKIGAI Asset Manager. The report states that EBITDA must exceed Rs1,000 per ton to justify returns on capital.

  • The report cites a current EBITDA of Rs800 per ton, leading to a post-tax ROCE of only 3%.
  • Incremental investments will require doubling current profitability.
  • India's combined listed cement companies have a market capitalization exceeding USD100 billion.
  • Top four players are expected to account for over 75% of capacity additions by FY27.
  • More than 25% of limestone mines will expire by 2035, posing future challenges.
  • Shifting to renewable energy could reduce operational costs significantly.
  • Despite being the second-largest market, cement is among the cheapest commodities in India.
  • The growth in cement demand historically follows GDP growth, but pricing power remains low.
“Each Rs1 increase in cement price per bag could add Rs67 billion to the EBITDA of the top 10 players.”

The future growth of the industry depends on demand dynamics, strategic pricing, and the adoption of cost-effective renewable energy solutions.
newTitle: Incremental Investment in the Cement Sector Dependent on Profitability Improvements

"The healthcare vertical has been a boon for select IT firms, especially during challenging times in other segments."

newTitle: IT Firms Rely on Healthcare for Growth Amid Challenges

title: Manmohan Singh death: As mark of respect, Congress cancels all programmes for next seven days - The Hindu
summary:
Congress Cancels Programs for a Week in Honor of Manmohan Singh

Publication Date: December 27, 2024, Source: The Hindu

The Congress party has announced the cancellation of all official programmes for the next seven days in memory of former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh, who passed away at the age of 92.

  • Former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh died at AIIMS, New Delhi.
  • The Congress has cancelled its foundation day celebrations and all other official events.
  • Congress flag will be flown at half-mast during this mourning period.
  • Party activities are set to resume on January 3, 2025.
  • Singh's death was announced at the conclusion of a Congress Working Committee meeting in Belagavi, Karnataka.
“Party programmes will resume on 3rd January 2025,” said K C Venugopal.

The Congress party is in a period of mourning as they honor the legacy of Dr. Manmohan Singh, who was instrumental in India’s economic reforms.
newTitle: Congress Cancels Programs for a Week in Honor of Manmohan Singh

title: Bengaluru foodie spends ₹5 lakh on a single restaurant visit, gets shout-out from Zomato - Hindustan Times
summary:
Bengaluru foodie spends ₹5 lakh on a single restaurant visit, gets shout-out from Zomato

Date: Dec 27, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

This article highlights a foodie in Bengaluru who spent an outrageous ₹5 lakh on a single restaurant visit, as reported by Zomato in its year-end statistics report for 2024.

  • A Bengaluru food lover spent ₹5,13,733 on one restaurant bill.
  • Zomato revealed that 2024 saw more than 9 crore biryani orders in India.
  • Indians reserved over 1 crore tables through Zomato between January 1 and December 6, 2024.
  • Delhi residents saved ₹195 crore on dining out bills, making it the most budget-friendly city.
  • For the ninth consecutive year, biryani was the most-ordered dish in India.
  • Tea emerged as the most-ordered beverage, surpassing coffee.
Zomato stated, 'A nation of biryani lovers, for sure.'

The takeaway is that food trends in India continue to thrive, with considerable spending on dining out and biryani maintaining its popularity among Indians.

title: PSU banks to cross ₹1.5 lakh cr profit in FY'25, low deposit mobilisation concern | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Public Sector Banks Expected to Surpass ₹1.5 Lakh Crore Profit in FY’25 Amid Deposit Concerns

Date: December 27, 2024 | Source: PTI

Public sector banks (PSBs) are projected to exceed profits of ₹1.5 lakh crore in the fiscal year 2024-25, driven by low non-performing assets (NPAs) and strong credit growth.

  • PSBs reported a 25% increase in net profit to ₹85,520 crore in H1’FY25.
  • The highest-ever net profit recorded was ₹1.41 lakh crore in FY24.
  • Gross NPA ratio improved to 3.12% as of September 2024, down from 14.58% in March 2018.
  • CRAR rose to 15.43%, exceeding RBI’s minimum requirement.
  • Challenges include slower deposit growth compared to credit growth and rising digital fraud incidents.
“We expect deposit rates to decline with a lag even if the rate cuts were to start from the upcoming MPC meeting.” - Sachin Sachdeva, ICRA Vice President

Despite facing challenges like slower deposit growth and digital fraud, the banking sector's profitability is forecasted to remain strong as it continues to support economic growth.
newTitle: Public Sector Banks Expected to Surpass ₹1.5 Lakh Crore Profit in FY’25 Amid Deposit Concerns

summary:
Salman Khan's Sikandar Teaser Postponed Due to Manmohan Singh's Demise

Date: December 26, 2024 Source: Bollywood Hungama

In a mark of respect to the late former Prime Minister of India, Dr. Manmohan Singh, the makers of Salman Khan’s much-awaited film, Sikandar, have postponed the release of the teaser from December 27 to December 28.

  • The teaser was originally set to coincide with Khan's birthday.
  • The announcement was made via social media by the production team.
  • The delay is a gesture of respect for the late leader.
“In light of the passing of our esteemed former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh Ji, we regret to announce that the release of the Sikandar teaser has been postponed to 28th December 11:07 AM. Our thoughts are with the nation during this time of mourning. Thank you for understanding.” — Nadiadwala Grandson

Dr. Manmohan Singh passed away on December 26 at the age of 92. His leadership significantly impacted India’s economic policy and governance.

The decision to delay the teaser reflects the sentiments of the nation during this time of mourning.
newTitle: Salman Khan's Sikandar Teaser Postponed Due to Manmohan Singh's Demise

title: 6 Black hole images at the center of galaxy captured by NASA - India.com
summary:
6 Black hole images at the center of galaxy captured by NASA

Publication Date: December 2024 Source: India.com

This article discusses the impressive images of black holes captured by NASA, highlighting the technological collaboration involved in this monumental achievement.

  • A black hole is defined as a dense object with an extreme gravitational pull.
  • Images were obtained using a global network of eight radio telescopes, functioning as an Earth-sized telescope.
  • The first image of a supermassive black hole was obtained in 2019 from the M87 galaxy.
  • In 2022, the first image of Sagittarius A*, the black hole at the Milky Way's center, was released.
  • The M87 black hole is approximately 6.5 billion times the mass of the Sun, while Sagittarius A* is about 4 million times the mass of the Sun.
  • The captured images illustrate the black hole located about 55 million light-years away from Earth.
“Thanks For Reading! Next: 7 stunning images of deep space shared by NASA.”

This accomplishment marks a significant milestone in astrophysics, deepening our understanding of black holes and space.
newTitle: 6 Black hole images at the center of galaxy captured by NASA

title: ICAI Result: 4 candidates top CA Final exam, country gets 11,500 new Chartered Accountants - Hindustan Times
summary:
ICAI CA Final Result 2024: A total of 11,500 candidates qualified as Chartered Accountants, the Insitute of Chartered Accountants of India (ICAI) has announced.

Date: Dec 27, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The ICAI has announced that a total of 11,500 candidates have successfully qualified as Chartered Accountants this year, emphasizing the impressive performance of students.

  • Heramb Maheshwari from Hyderabad and Rishab Ostwal R from Tirupati jointly secured the all-India first rank.
  • Riya Kunjankumar Shah from Ahmedabad is the second topper.
  • Kinjal Ajmera from Kolkata secured the third rank.
  • Total candidates who appeared: 66,987; total passed: 11,253 in Group 1 with a pass percentage of 16.8%.
  • In Group 2, 49,459 candidates wrote the exam; 10,566 passed with a pass percentage of 21.36%.
  • For candidates appearing in both groups, 30,763 showed up, with 4,134 passing (13.44% pass rate).
"Individual exam results can be accessed at the institute's result portal, icai.nic.in."

The successful results of this examination highlight the continued demand and rigorous standards in the field of Chartered Accountancy in India.
newTitle: ICAI CA Final Result 2024: 11,500 New Chartered Accountants Announced

On the occasion of Salman Khan's 59th birthday, the teaser launch for his upcoming film Sikandar was set for today but has been postponed following the death of former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh.

UltraTech buys 8.69% stake from Star Cement promoter group for ₹851 crore - CNBCTV18
summary:
UltraTech buys 8.69% stake from Star Cement promoter group for ₹851 crore

Date: Dec 27, 2024
Source: CNBC TV18

In a notable move in the cement industry, UltraTech Cement Ltd. has acquired an 8.69% stake in Star Cement Ltd. from its promoter group for ₹851 crore.

  • UltraTech acquired the shares at ₹235 per share.
  • This stake is a non-controlling minority stake in Star Cement.
  • Star Cement, based in Meghalaya, reported a turnover of ₹2,910 crore in FY 2024.
  • UltraTech recently also acquired a 32.72% stake in India Cements, making it a subsidiary.
  • Star Cement boasts a 7.7 MTPA grinding capacity and a 26.5% market share in the north-eastern market.
  • The company is planning a ₹380 crore capex for the second half of FY 2024.
“The blocks are estimated to have geological limestone reserves of 63.9 million tonnes.”

This acquisition indicates UltraTech's ongoing strategy of consolidation in the cement sector.
newTitle: UltraTech Acquires 8.69% Stake in Star Cement for ₹851 Crore

WHO chief narrowly escapes from Israel’s strikes in Yemen - The Hindu
summary:
WHO Chief Escapes Israeli Airstrikes in Yemen

Date: December 27, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

This article discusses a recent incident on December 26, 2024, where WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus narrowly escaped from airstrikes in Yemen while preparing to depart from the airport in Sanaa. The strikes are part of escalating military actions in the region.

  • Israeli airstrikes targeted Houthi positions in Yemen, including the airport in Sanaa.
  • WHO chief Tedros reported that he was near the attack and a crew member was injured.
  • At least three individuals were killed and dozens injured due to the strikes.
  • The attack followed previous Houthi missile launches into Israel.
  • U.N. officials are assessing damage at the airport to determine when flights can resume.
  • The situation has raised alarm among international leaders and organizations.
“Our mission to negotiate the release of UN staff detainees and to assess the health and humanitarian situation in Yemen concluded today.” — Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus

This incident highlights the ongoing turmoil in Yemen and the wider implications for regional stability, calling for urgent attention and humanitarian support.
newTitle: WHO Chief Escapes Israeli Airstrikes in Yemen
